title: Three arrested in connection to shooting of student
content:
Three people, including two juveniles, were arrested in connection to the shooting of a 15-year-old Northside High School student on the 2000 block of Moss Street Monday.
According to a press release from the Lafayette Police Department, witnesses identified Dejaun Clay, 18, of Lafayette, as the shooter. He was located and booked into the Lafayette Parish Correctional Center for aggravated battery by shooting.
Through further investigation, two juveniles were arrested for illegal possession of a handgun by a juvenile. Both were booked into the Lafayette Juvenile Detention Center.
The Lafayette Parish School System has confirmed that the victim, who is in stable condition at a local hospital, is a student at Northside High School. The student's injuries were considered non-life threatening.
"The shooting took place after school and away from the campus," the district said in a news release. "Lafayette Parish School System officials are cooperating with the police department to bring the investigation to a quick conclusion."
